revised_title: Astronomical Alignments in British Stone Circles
tldr: The author investigates the astronomical alignments in British stone circles, particularly in Aberdeenshire, and finds that they were used to observe the sunrise during the summer solstice and the commencement of the May-year. The alignments were made by observing the rising sun or stars through the circles, and the author suggests that these stone circles were built by ancient people with advanced astronomical knowledge.
